intro: Braya novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand rock-brake, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species of mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, fleshy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils in coastal and alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
